de.thesycon.usbio
Class UsbIoBuf

java.lang.Object
  de.thesycon.usbio.UsbIoBuf
public class UsbIoBuf
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used as a buffer descriptor of buffers used for read and write operations.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Thesycon

Field Summary
 byte[] BufferMem
          Reference to the Buffer.
 int BytesTransferred
          This public member indicates the number of bytes successfully transferred to or from the buffer during a read or write operation.

          This public member specifies the number of bytes to be transferred to or from the buffer in a subsequent read or write operation.
 boolean OperationFinished
          This public member is used as a flag.
 int Size
          This public member contains the size, in bytes, of the memory block that is attached to the UsbIoBuf object.
 int Status
          This public member indicates the completion status of a read or write operation.
 
Constructor Summary
UsbIoBuf(int Size)
          Construct a UsbIoBuf object and allocate a buffer internally.

Field Detail

Handle

protected int Handle

BufferMem

public byte[] BufferMem
Reference to the Buffer.

Size

public int Size
This public member contains the size, in bytes, of the memory block that is attached to the UsbIoBuf object. The value is zero if no memory block is attached.

Status

public int Status
This public member indicates the completion status of a read or write operation.

Note that this member will be set after a read or write operation is completed.

NumberOfBytesToTransfer

public int NumberOfBytesToTransfer
This public member specifies the number of bytes to be transferred to or from the buffer in a subsequent read or write operation.

Note that this member has to be set before the read or write operation is initiated by means of read or write.

BytesTransferred

public int BytesTransferred
This public member indicates the number of bytes successfully transferred to or from the buffer during a read or write operation.

Note that this member will be set after a read or write operation is completed.

OperationFinished

public boolean OperationFinished
This public member is used as a flag. If it is set to true then it indicates that the data transfer operation is finished altogether. Read or write processing will be terminated by UsbIoReader or UsbIoWriter.

Constructor Detail

UsbIoBuf

public UsbIoBuf(int Size)
Construct a UsbIoBuf object and allocate a buffer internally.

Parameters:
Size - Specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer to be allocated and attached to the descriptor object.
